title: Why does my phone screen display the voicemail?
answer: It's a reminder to you. Voice messages are stored on the carrier server. You need to dial the voice message number to listen to the message. After you have listened to the message, the notification will not be displayed any more. If you clean up the notification without listening to the message, you'll miss the message. Solution to clean up voice messages: 1. Touch and hold New Voicemail and swipe left or right. 2. In the displayed dialog box, touch OK to clean up the new voicemail notification on the notification panel. ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=140255) After the phone is restarted, the notification is displayed on the notification panel again. You need to repeat the preceding steps. [To listen to the message:]() Call your carrier's customer service to obtain the local voicemail number. Go to Call Settings > Voicemail > Voicemail settings > Voicemail number. Enter the number you have obtained.
